title: How Many Calories in an Everything Bagel?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in an everything bagel, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in an Everything Bagel?
assumptions: Standard medium bagel (~100 g), baked plain with everything topping (sesame seeds, poppy seeds, dried onion, garlic, salt); no fillings or spreads.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, baking method, and toppings; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One everything bagel provides ~270 kcal, mostly from carbs, with 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in an everything bagel without toppings?
faqs.a: A plain bagel base is similar, around 250-270 kcal; everything seasoning adds minimal calories.

faqs.q: What's the carb count for an everything bagel?
faqs.a: About 53 g carbs per bagel, including 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: Are everything bagels high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~520 mg sodium due to the salt in the everything mix.

faqs.q: How does bagel size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller bagels (~85 g) have ~220 kcal; larger ones (~120 g) up to 320 kcal.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie everything bagel?
faqs.a: Opt for whole grain or thin versions, or skip high-cal spreads to reduce totals.
